comments:

Created an attachment (id=67102)
Test program

Attached is the test program which I used. Steps to reproduce
1. Run as SWT appln
2. Click on First tab item
3. Click on "GO" button
4. Close the window
You will see exception

It seems that InPlaceDeactivate() calls UpdateWindow() or some other Windows call that forces WM_PAINT's to be delivered.  This is bad during dispose.  Dunong to make this happen, confirm that it's only Vista (not XP) and we will assess what we can do with Silenio.
+1 (to work around the problem in CTabFolder for now.  Do not close this bug)

Fixed > 20070516

This only fixes the CTabFolder scenario. I'll continue to investigate the general case.
